identificationModule.briefTitle: Stroke Ready - Optimizing Acute Stroke Care
identificationModule.officialTitle: Stroke Ready - Optimizing Acute Stroke Care

collaborators.name: National Institute on Minority Health and Health Disparities (NIMHD)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The study aims to increase acute stroke treatment rates in Flint, Michigan through a two-pronged approach of hospital and community level interventions. It also aims to inform future stroke preparedness interventions by exploring the relative importance of hospital optimization and community interventions.

designInfo.interventionModelDescription: Stroke Ready is a stepped wedge design to be delivered to each of the four Flint community quadrants over the course of 2 years.

armGroups.label: Stroke Ready Community intervention
armGroups.description: We divided the Flint community into four quadrants. We will focus our workshops and posters on one quadrant, but not exclusively, moving quadrants every 6 months over the course of two years.

interventions.name: Stroke Ready
interventions.description: Stroke Ready community intervention consists of peer facilitated educational workshops, stroke music video, and mass media campaign including print materials (e.g. posters, brochure), health promotion mailers, radio/Television public health service announcements, and the Stroke Ready website and Facebook page.

primaryOutcomes.description: Acute stroke treatment rate - community wide. Retrospective data captured through medical record review
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Time frame: 11 years of data will be reviewed

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of emergency department arrivals by ambulance
secondaryOutcomes.description: Optimize community for acute stroke (community level)--retrospective data captured through medical record review
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Time frame: 11 years of data will be reviewed

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria: Inclusion criteria:Adult stroke patients who presented to one of three hospitals in the Flint community.

references.citation: Robles MC, Springer MV, Corches CL, Burke JF, Lin CC, Oliver A, Skolarus LE. Stroke Ready Very Brief Intervention Improves Immediate Postintervention Stroke Preparedness. Circ Cardiovasc Qual Outcomes. 2020 Dec;13(12):e006643. doi: 10.1161/CIRCOUTCOMES.120.006643. Epub 2020 Nov 26. No abstract available.

Skolarus LE, Sales AE, Zimmerman MA, Corches CL, Landis-Lewis Z, Robles MC, McBride AC, Rehman N, Oliver A, Islam N, Springer MV, O'Brien A, Bailey S, Morgenstern LB, Meurer WJ, Burke JF. Stroke Ready: a multi-level program that combines implementation science and community-based participatory research approaches to increase acute stroke treatment: protocol for a stepped wedge trial. Implement Sci. 2019 Mar 7;14(1):24. doi: 10.1186/s13012-019-0869-3.
